title: ‘South to Freedom’ Review: México Libre
sub_head: The little-told story of runaway slaves in Mexico, and of relations between the U.S. and its southern neighbor in the antebellum period.
body: In the summer of 1835, a slave named Jean Antoine managed to sneak into the sweltering hold of a Mexican vessel while it was docked in New Orleans. Concealed amid the cargo, with any noises he made muffled by the surf, the fugitive eluded capture during the 11-day voyage across the Gulf of Mexico. At some point en route, however, the ship’s captain detected the presence of the stowaway, and upon reaching the port of Campeche he enlisted the help of its mayor in locating the unbidden guest.
